1.verse: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and brother Timothy, To Philemon, our dear friend and fellow helper;

2.verse: and to dear sister Apphia, and to Archippus, our fellow soldier, and to the church in your house:

3.verse: Grace be with you, and peace, from God our Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I give thanks to my God (making mention of you always in my prayers

5.verse: when I hear of your love and faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints,

6.verse: so that the fellowship of your faith may be made effective, and that whatever good thing is in you through Christ Jesus may be known).

7.verse: For we have great joy and encouragement in your love because by you, brother, the saints’ hearts are comforted.

8.verse: Therefore, though I am very bold in Christ to command you that which is appropriate,

9.verse: yet for love’s sake, rather, I exhort you (though I am as I am: old, and even now a prisoner for Jesus Christ)

10.verse: I encourage you for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my imprisonment

11.verse: (who in the past was unprofitable to you, but is now profitable to both you and me)

12.verse: and whom I have sent again. Therefore, receive him who is my own heart,

13.verse: whom I wanted to keep with me so that he might have ministered to me in your place in the bonds of the Gospel.

14.verse: But I do not wish to do anything without your consent, so that your goodness would not be out of necessity, but willingly.

15.verse: Therefore, it may be that he departed for a season so that you would receive him forever

16.verse: (no longer as a servant, but above a servant, as a beloved brother), especially to me but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord?

17.verse: Therefore, if you count us as partners, receive him as me.

18.verse: If he has hurt you, or owes you anything, put that on my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, have written this with my own hand. I will repay it. Though I do not mention that even you owe me yourself.

20.verse: Yes, brother, let me obtain this pleasure from you in the Lord. Comfort my heart in the Lord.

21.verse: Trusting in your obedience, I wrote to you knowing that you will do even more than I say.

22.verse: In addition, prepare lodging for me also. For I trust I shall be freely given to you through your prayers.

23.verse: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you;

24.verse: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas and Luke, my fellow helpers.

25.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen. (Written from Rome to Philemon and sent by Onesimus, a servant.)
